Certainly! "The Only Exception" was co-written by lead vocalist Hayley Williams and lead guitarist Josh Farro of the American rock band, Paramore. According to Williams, the song was inspired by "personal experience", which many believe to be her relationship with Farro. Musically, the song is known for its gentle, acoustic guitar opening and gradual build-up to a soaring chorus.

In terms of the lyrics, Williams has explained that she wanted to explore the idea of unconditional love and finding someone who accepts you for who you are, flaws and all. The song's chorus particularly emphasizes the idea of the "only exception" being the one person who can surpass all of the narrator's doubts and fears. The song's bridge shifts the focus to the narrator's own insecurities, as she sings, "I've got a tight grip on reality, but I can't let go of what's in front of me here."

Overall, "The Only Exception" has been praised for its introspective, vulnerable lyrics and lush, emotional melody.
